title: Treating and Preventing Shock
brief: How to position and treat victims to prevent or manage shock in survival situations.
steps: If victim is conscious: place on level surface with lower extremities elevated 15 to 20 centimeters.
If victim is unconscious: place on side or abdomen with head turned to one side to prevent choking.
If unsure of best position: place victim perfectly flat.
Once positioned, do not move the victim.
Remove wet clothing immediately and replace with dry clothing.
Insulate victim from surroundings using shelter, sleeping bags, or clothing.
Provide external warmth using warm liquids, heated rocks wrapped in clothing, or fires on either side.
If conscious, slowly give small doses of warm salt or sugar solution.
Have victim rest for at least 24 hours.
warnings: Do not give fluids to unconscious victims or those with abdominal wounds
Do not move victim once positioned for shock treatment
If alone and in shock, lie with head lower than feet in sheltered area
